reviewText: Got this to assist with fire safety presentations, which will work great. Showed my 2 and 9 year old first, they loved it. It is a educational DVD and entertaining.

This is the Disney Classroom Edition DVD which includes two programs. First up is Donald's Fire Survival Plan (Revised) which edits together animation of Donald and nephews Huey, Dewey and Louie from the original 1965 short Donald's Fire Survival Plan (original voice-over is redubbed) with live-action footage filmed circa 1984 of a dad and three sons learning about the E.D.I.T.H. home fire-safety plan (12 minutes).

The second program Donald's Fire Drill (1991) is a "game show" formatted live-action sketch featuring the theme-park costumed Donald Duck, a live host and two children answering questions about fire safety (16 minutes). Printable educator's guide included on disc.
